Description: East Greek terracotta figure of Kore as a vessel, possibly an alabastron. Fragment of shoulder and left arm. Mould-made. East Greek pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver mica and common very fine quartz and black inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar parallels of standing kore (GR1860,0404.57 from Kamiros), seated kore (GR1886,0401.1398 also Naukratis) or as alabastron (GR1861,0425.34 from Kamiros) all in similar micaceous orange fabric and all dated late 6th century BC (Higgins 1954, no.61). Parallel from Lindos, Rhodes, dated 525 BC - 400 BC (Blinkenberg 1931, pl. 85, no. 2118). Originally thought to be made in Rhodes (Higgins 1954, 48-9), but probably Milesian as Jones' NAA analysis of GR1888,0601.659 also from Naukratis, places it within his East Greek, probably Milesian group (Jones 1985, 673). Naukratis Kore heads British Museum GR1886,0401.1400 and 1421 and Cambridge MCA NA321 and NA 324, all have a similar micaceous orange fabric. Higgins cites parallels from Cumae, Selinus, Lindos, Ialysus and Thera (Maximova 1927, no.68; Blinkenberg 1931; Higgins 1954, 50). Blinkenberg, C. 1931. Lindos. Fouilles de l’Acropole 1902-1914, I. Les petits objets, Berlin. Jones, R. E. 1985. Greek and Cypriot Pottery: A Review of Scientific Studies. Athens. Maximova, M. I. 1927. Les vases plastiques dans l’antiquité. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.051) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 81, no. 24)
